snippet: Bill de Blasio raised $761,000 in the most recent filing period, but he still lags Christine C. Quinn and Scott M. Stringer.
abstract: New York City's Campaign Finance Board reports that Bill de Blasio, city's public advocate, raised $761,000 over the past six months, marking the second consecutive filing period in which he has outraised his likely rivals in the 2013 race for mayor; he continues, however, to play catch-up with City Council Speaker Christine C Quinn and Manhattan Borough Pres Scott M Stringer, who both got enormous head starts by rolling over hundreds of thousands of dollars from previous campaigns.
lead_paragraph: Bill de Blasio raised $761,000 in the most recent filing period, but he still lags Christine C. Quinn and Scott M. Stringer.

headline.seo: De Blasio Outraises Potential Rivals for New York City Mayor
headline.main: In Race for Mayor, Public Advocate Outraises His Potential Opponents Again
headline.print_headline: In Race for Mayor, Public Advocate Outraises His Potential Opponents Again
